conversations.content: You there! Lickspittle! Where are all of my new soldiers?!
I'm afraid we had far fewer volunteers than we'd hoped for, Your Majesty. Er, and we also don't appear to have the budget to increase our armaments either.
Bah! Pathetic! We'll NEVER match Valkaheim's military prowess at this rate!
But fine. Whatever. Magnus, have we received any response to our request to ally with our neighbors?
Not a peep, sire.
So they're just IGNORING ME?! How very dare those churls!
Hmm... I wonder what my dear sister Chelle would do at a time like this?
If I may, Emperor Emile?
What is it, Saboa?
Begging your pardon, sire, but I wonder if perhaps acting in the manner of your siblings might be to your detriment.
You have your own gifts and talents, so perhaps it's best you turn to those.
A fact I am very well aware of, thank you!
But one can't rule a country with music and paintings, so my prodigious gifts are as good as dirt here!
That's not true at all! Your talents are just as precious—
My talents are worth SQUAT in terms of what we're dealing with now, and that is the end of it! The only way I can run this damn place is if I act like one of them...
But you could never become one of them, Your Majesty!
...Say that again.
M-my deepest apologies if I've spoken out of turn, Your Majesty! I meant only—
Get out.
GET OUT! ALL OF YOU! OUT, OUT, OOOOUT! I don't want to see a single one of your ugly mugs around here!
Damn it all. Dammit, dammit, dammit!
They deign to think they know the first thing about me?! ME?! EMILE?!
I'm trying everything I possibly can, but I just don't know what to do.
Oh, yes. I thought you might be a king of literature, one able to change our militaristic nation.
Farewell to you, my son. I pray that you become a good and just ruler.
(I know someone said such a thing to me, but I don't remember who.)
What the hell is a king of literature, anyway? And how exactly do I become a ＂good and just＂ ruler?
Ah, Emperor Emile.
Who dares intrude? I could have sworn I told the lot of you to get the hell out of my sight!
It is Minister Werner, my liege. And after such an insolent outburst, it is no wonder you flew into a rage.
I have brought the highest quality grape juice for you. Please have some and let it soothe your jangled nerves.
...Fine. Get in here.
You are ever merciful, Your Majesty. Now please, do try the grape juice. It is of the finest quality.
I'm glad to see SOMEONE around here has some sense. Give me that. *glug*
NGH?! *splutter* *hack* *wheeeeze*
Is it not wonderful, Your Majesty? I see you are ready to faint dead away from the deliciousness of it all.
Ah but it is truly the finest quality... the finest quality POISON!
W-Werner... What have...you done?!
You call yourself an emperor and don't even bother to test your drink for blight? Such carelessness truly shows how unfit you are to lead.
You...little... *gasp*
My family served the emperor of the original Dyrenell Empire.
Which means I am descended from those your pathetic family tore from power.
Wha?!
As heir to the honorable Dyrenell house, I am far more worthy of ruling this country than you Alberian filth.
You there! Solider! Throw this rubbish in the river where it belongs.
Yes, sir!
No... Stop... *hack* *cough*
(C-can't stay awake... Is this...the end... for poor Emile...?)
...I'm alive.
But wait... Am I REALLY alive, or did I die back there and end up in some kind of terribly dull afterlife?
Oh, you're quite alive.
Wait. I know you.
Yes! You're that teacher from my academy! What are YOU doing here?!
I found you floating in an estuary while swimming on the coast of Saint Lotier.
I hated the thought of your corpse tainting the waters of my beloved sea, so I brought you here instead.
How dare you accuse my beautiful body of tainting anything!
Oh, but it would. For you see, having the body of the man who broke our pact in my waters was far too much to bear.
I don't make pacts with teachers, fool! Unless... Wait. Wait just one moment...
I mean, I'm clearly just having a laugh here, but, uh, you're not the Waterwyrm by some chance, right?
In the flesh.
OH, YOU'VE GOTTA BE KIDDING ME! I'm taking back the crush I had on you...
I'm sorry, what did you say?
I said nothing! Maybe get your ears checked, you blathering boob!
Oh ho! Someone finally woke up!
Indeed, and thank you again for lending us this fine room.
Hey, you got money, I got rooms. Speaking of which, I assume this gent here is the one who's paying?
Ex-CUSE me? You want ME to pay? Don't be absurd! I'm an emperor!
Ha ha! Sure you are, buddy—and I'm the king of Grams! ...Here's the bill.
Oh, and if you can't pay, I'll be taking you straight to Lord Zacharias.
Zacharias? But that means...
You're in Saint Lotier, yes.
And for what possible reason did you take me to this urine-soaked hellhole?! Do you have ANY idea what I did here?!
Oh, I do. Yet it was a race against time. Would you have preferred to die in the waters instead?
Nnngh...
Now then, if you don't wish to cause a scene, I would recommend paying.
Never! Besides, I didn't ask you to save me in the first place!
Hmm. It seems we are at an impasse.
Innkeep, if I keep watch of this ingrate, can you call the officials?
Step ahead of you, miss.
NONONONONO WAAAAAAIT! This is a jape, right? A merry jape? You cannot be serious!
Oh, but I am deathly serious. Those who commit crimes must be brought to justice.
Look, if you don't wanna get thrown in the slammer, just pay up already—and if you're short of coin, I'm sure you can find plenty of work here in town.
The idea of ＂work＂ is all well and good for you, but if I go traipsing about town trying to employ myself as a scullery wench or whatnot, they'll simply haul me in anyway!
*sigh* Well, I don't wish to trouble this poor innkeep any more than I already have, so it seems I'm stuck.
Emile, be a good boy and wait here.
Huh?
Well, well! Now THIS is an outfit!
I believe this should be enough to disguise your identity for the time being.
However, do not think you can get away without paying your dues; Zacharias is not so forgiving as all that.
Grr... Fine, then! If I must work off this absurd debt, then that is what I shall do!
(But can I really do this all by myself?)
(DAMN IT ALL! SOMEONE SAVE MEEEE!)
So, um...Waterwyrm.
Yes?
Find me some work.
Is that how you speak to a dragon such as myself? Find your own work.
But you're the one who said I had to work! You cannot simply leave me figuratively dead in the water after that.
I can and will. In fact, I already rescued you from drowning once, and even went so far as to procure clothes for you to disguise yourself.
The rest is up to you.
Damn you, you heartless pactwyrm! Er, or ex-pactwyrm, I suppose.
Everyone keeps telling me to work, but where am I even supposed to start?
You there! Lickspittle! Where are all of my new soldiers?!
I'm afraid we had far fewer volunteers than we'd hoped for, Your Majesty. Er, and we also don't appear to have the budget to increase our armaments either.
Of course! That's it! I just have to ＂volunteer＂ my amazing services!
Well then, haste makes waste, so Operation: Get a Job begins now!
Rejoice, peon! I, the great Emperor Emile, have decided to work in your employ!
You still on about that emperor business? You're an adult, friend—best quit playing pretend and join us in the real world.
Why, you insolent little... I AM the one true emperor, you dolt! By all rights, you should be the one serving me!
You've got some serious attitude for a fella what can't even pay his bill. But I've been hurting for staff lately, so if you really wanna work it off, I won't complain.
Think you can handle the reception desk? 'Cause if so, I need you there pronto.
I merely check people in? Child's play! Come round, travelers, and let your jaws slacken at the fact the great Emile has prepared rooms for you all!
Oh boy...
You've done well to come to the great Emperor Emile's inn! Rejoice, for I have prepared a fine room for you at a very reasonable discount!
Thanks for that, frie—HEY! What part of this qualifies as a reasonable discount?! I can't even count all these zeroes!
You dare complain about a price the emperor chose for you?! A man has to make money somehow, you know!
Like I give a crap about your wallet! This is a total rip-off, and you know it!
How dare you speak that way to an emperor! Now pay that bill before I have you dragged off to the gallows!
EEEEEEK!
What the hell do you think you're doing?!
Stupid little ingrate... I was TRYING to help the man!
You're clearly not cut out for the kind of work I do here—and possibly not any kind—so it's time for you to go ply your trade somewhere else.
Still, I know you tried in your own way, so I'll give you more time to pay off what you owe to me.
He thinks he's doing ME a favor? Ha! But fine, then. I'll just find another job.
I'm sorry, but I don't think you're the right fit for this job.
Got no time for folks what don't have experience. Go bother someone else.
Do you even know HOW to wash a dish, you useless clod?!
I can't believe this... I haven't managed to make a single rupie!
These people must be blind to not see how I overflow with talent and potential! Why, it oozes out of me! OOZES, I say!
Guy's pactbound dragon bailed on him, and then the brother he thought was a huge chump waxed the floor with him. Woof! Talk about your rough days.
How come we get saddled with a lousy commander like that? Hell, I'll take a traitor prince over a loser prince any day!
It seems I'm a loser here as well...
Oh, blast it all! Why do I have to be hungry at a time like this?!
Do you need something to eat, sir?
And just who are you?
I was painting over there when I heard you talking to yourself.
Here. You can have half of my sandwich.
You think to show ME charity? What manner of chump do you take me for?!
Oh! Um, right. Sorry about that. It's fine if you don't want any.
Well, I suppose I can appreciate the guts it takes to offer your own food to someone of my caliber, so...gimme.
*munch* *slurp* *snorf* *gulp* Goodness! That was amazing.
Ha ha! Wow, you really WERE hungry!
Excuse me. Is this painting for sale?
Yes, of course! ...Sorry, sir, but I have to get going. Business calls!
Would this be enough?
Oh, certainly! Thank you very much!
(That dreck is making money? ...Wait. Wait a second. I can work with this!)
You there! Hand over your art supplies!
B-but they're the tools of my trade, sir!
The people's possessions are my possessions also! Now quit your whinging and fork 'em over!
No, wait! Ugh, what a pushy little man...
...Now THAT'S what I call a painting!
You there! Put this painting up with your other paintings for sale—and be certain to display it in the front!
Huh?
That's an order, peasant!
Oh, how stunning!
Hmm?
Such fine touches! Such bold composition! I've never seen such a vivacious picture of the sea before. You absolutely must sell it to me!
Y-you'll really buy it?
Freely and gladly! You have a gift, my boy, and I would love to come by again once you paint another.
I sold it...and even better, someone actually praised my work!
THIS is how I'll raise the money I need! Time to paint like the wind!
A few days later
That about covers your little stay. You really made a killing out there.
Your paintings are the talk of the town.
Oh, that was nothing for someone so handsome and talented as I. Now good day to you, innkeep!
FREE AT LAST!
Here I thought this place was a right cesspool of humanity, yet there are so many who appreciate the fine arts!
Saint Lotier has risen in the ranks now that it has acknowledged the value of my paintings! It is now less of a cesspool and more of a...cesspuddle.
It seems you're finally starting to understand how wonderful this place is.
Mercury?! Why are YOU still here?!
I've been keeping watch to make certain you didn't turn tail and flee.
Do you know why there are so many people in Saint Lotier who love and appreciate the fine arts, Emile?
Because a bunch of people with good taste flocked here?
No. It is because Zacharias has brought and maintained peace in this land.
Peace allows people to do more than just survive—it allows them to thrive and appreciate the finer things in life.
Wait. But that would mean...
Are you saying the reason no one ever appreciated my talents was because my country was in disarray?
If the empire had been peaceful, your talents might very well have been lauded.
Everything hinges now on what you feel, and how you act upon those feelings. So then, what will you do?
You say people will start to appreciate me if the country is more peaceful, sooo...
Emile?
SO BE IT! As emperor, I will see to it that my nation is the most peaceful anywhere!
Wait, Emile! It won't be that simple! ...Oh, there he goes again—and still as selfish as ever, sadly.
However, he HAS grown, even if by a little.
*pant* *pant* I'M BACK, BABY!
Still, I'm going to need a lot of allies if I hope to reclaim my rightful place on the throne.
With my loyal subjects at my side, I'll show that dastard Werner just how far below me he truly is! Aha ha ha!
...And speak of the devil! Ho there! You!
Er, me?
Your grand leader, the great and powerful Emperor Emile, has returned! Now gather up that pathetic sack of bone and skin you call a body and rise to fight at my side!
Uhhh...the emperor? You? Seriously? Er, I guess maybe I see a resemblance to Emile if I squint really hard, but...
I VERY MUCH BEG YOUR PARDON?! Since when are you slack-jawed peasants on a first name basis with me?!
Friend, I don't have time to mess around with impersonators or...whatever you are. Now please, leave me be.
Don't you walk away from me, you wretch! Ooo, I'm going to have you clapped in irons and thrown into the dankest hole in all the land!
Ah! You there! I, the great and benevolent Emperor Emile, have finally made my long-awaited and triumphant return!
Don't you ignore me!
Oy, give 'er a rest, wouldja?! I'm busy! Go do yer impressions to someone what gives a fig, ya daft dandy!
IMPRESSIONS?! Why, I simply cannot BELIEVE the insolence of these people! She's definitely going to join that other fellow in the pit once I'm in power again...
Hmm... But now that I think about it, why does everyone here seem to be in such a terrible hurry?
Did no one ever teach them to listen when they are spoken to? This is PRECISELY why I never mingle with the common folk unless I have a hankering for pottage...
Yes, well, never mind all that. I'm certain I'll find someone who knows how to pay proper respects if I go somewhere with more people.
Ah, excellent! I knew I'd find people here! Time to lay on that famous Emile charm... *iiiiiiiinhaaaaaaaale*
ATTEND ME, YOU DOGSBODIES! YOUR GREAT AND POWERFUL EMPEROR EMILE HAS RETURNED!
Emile?
Wait. Like, THAT Emile?
(Yes! See how they stare at me with utter and rapt attention! Now all that's left is to wait for them to raise a chorus of mighty huzzahs at my grand return!)
AAAAH HA HA HA HA!
Ah ha ha! You sound just like him, mister! Talk about your spot-on impressions!
Do you have manure in your eye, serf?! I AM the real Emile!
Nice try, buddy. We might even buy it if we hadn't all just been to Emile's funeral.
THE WHO OF YOU WENT TO THE WHAT?!
Wow, you're really loyal to the guy, huh? Makes sense you wouldn't want to believe he was assassinated.
But the longer you hide from reality, the harder it's gonna be on you.
Still, good on you, I suppose. I never thought the previous emperor had such ardent supporters on his side.
And what is THAT supposed to mean?!
I mean, even you have to admit he wasn't exactly the most benevolent ruler around.
Remember how he was constantly putting up these ridiculous statues? He loved to waste money like that.
Those statues were designed to showcase the power and glory of the emperor!
Yeah, well, they wound up forcing most of us to move to make room of 'em—and it ain't like we got compensated for it!
Emile was a real piece of work, all right. Like how he'd purposely cause problems just so he could swoop in and fix 'em in the hopes of earning our praise? Ha ha!
All pretty embarrassing, if I'm honest. Did he really think we were too dumb to see through all that?
You...you knew?!
And didn't he go around attacking places with dragons and combat androids?
Th-that was to demonstrate my power!
Guy didn't want to get down in the mud himself, so he sent someone else to do the dirty work. Some power that is!
Well, at least he had one true supporter. Suppose he can rest in peace with that!
AAAAH HA HA HA HA HA!
(I have no defense against the slings and arrows of their cruelty.)
(...Because it's true. Every word coming from their little peasant food holes is completely true.)
(All that I did was so I could force the world to acknowledge my power—and more specifically, to acknowledge ME.)
If the empire had been peaceful, your talents might very well have been lauded.
(All that I have done—all my efforts and schemes—have only served to tighten the noose around my own proud neck...)
(Perhaps there was never a way to succeed. Not for someone like me.)
(I've failed honestly and I've failed underhandedly. I'm just a...a loser.)
(I'm not fit to rule a pigsty, much less a nation!)
Gotta say though, I'd take ol' Emperor Emile over this new guy seven days a week and twice on Sunday.
Huh?
We work day and night just to pay the mad taxes he's set. He's treating us like slaves!
I hear he's using all that money to plan an attack on Saint Lotier.
We don't even want a war, and yet that's where our hard-earned money is going. Oh, but the world can be cruel.
The old Emperor had his issues, but at least he took it easy on the taxes.
Well, that's simply because I left all such matters up to Magnus, who...
(Wait a minute. This is my chance!)
(The opposite of war is PEACE! These people want peace!)
(If I dispose of Werner, end the war, and lower their taxes...)
(Everyone here will sing my praises and my country will HAVE to recognize me for my talents!)
Listen well, my dear and loyal subjects! I understand your plight all too well!
I, the great Emperor Emile, will free you from your suffering by taking out the pretender who now sits on the throne!
You all can rest easy and wait for the good news to come! Aha! Aha ha ha!
Er, you don't think that was the REAL Emperor Emile, do you?
Oh, there's no way. Still, whoever that fellow is, he's in for a world of hurt if he goes against the new emperor...
The coast is clear, aaaand...
I'm in! Ha! Who would've thought sneaking into the castle could be so easy? Me, that's who! Because I am a GENIUS!
Say, you hear something just now? Sounded like someone yelling about... being a genius?
Cripes! Keep your mouth shut, Emile, or this will all have been for nothing!
Footsteps from the other direction? Blast! I've nowhere to run!
What will I do, what will I do, what will I—HMPHGH?!
Okay, I SWEAR I heard something over there...
Aw, you're imagining things.
Looks like we managed to slip away.
MMRGHMMMMFGH!
Apologies, Your Majesty! Even if I was trying to help, it was terribly inappropriate of me to place my hand over your mouth as I did!
*gaaaaasp* *wheeeeeeze* It's...it's fine. You saved me, so I'll let it slide just this once, er...Saboa, is it?
I am. And welcome home...My Emperor. WAAAAAAAAH!
Heavens above, man! Are you crying?
I'm just so relieved to find you alive, Emperor Emile!
Oh. I see...
Also, how dare you think me dead, fool! No mere poison can lay ME low!
It gladdens me to see you as spirited as ever, Majesty.
But we cannot afford to revel in reunion now. You've come to reclaim your rightful place on the throne, have you not?
Of course! Why else would I be here?
Then we should go to the dungeon and set about freeing Magnus.
Why is Magnus in the dungeon?
He spoke out against the new emperor's tyranny and was imprisoned for it.
We always believed you would return to us someday, Majesty. Now let us rendezvous with Magnus and devise a plan to return your throne to you!
Saaay, wait a minute. Ain't you...?
Sorry, but I've not the time nor inclination to bandy either words or fists with brutes. ...GET HIM, SABOA!
BLARGH!
That voice... But it cannot be!
Are you in here, Magnus?
Emperor Emile!
Thank heavens you're okay, my friend! As you can see, Emperor Emile has returned to us.
Of course I did! This castle—nay, this COUNTRY—belongs to me, and I would never leave it behind!
But I need the assistance of you both if I am to transform this nation into one of peace.
My Emperor!
Is that truly what you want?!
I'll thank you not to look quite so shocked. This is something I must do for myself.
None of those miserable commoners out there will ever understand my talent if they can't do more than just survive.
Therefore, I will turn ours into a peaceful nation so they finally give me the respect, love, and worship I so richly deserve!
Now let's come up with a plan to take back my empire!
Did you both forget how to speak in the time I was gone?
No, Majesty. I was just thinking how you really haven't changed at all.
And what does THAT mean?
I couldn't agree more. But for now, let's discuss our plan.
Ah, wonderful! You already have one! ...Yes. ...Yes, I see. That just might... ARE YOU A PAIR OF DUNDERHEADS?! That's the dumbest plan I've ever heard!
I am prepared for any punishment you wish to inflict on me afterward, Majesty. For now, do you accept this plan?
It is the only way to get close to Werner— and as you've just arrived, there's no better time to put it into action.
Oh, fine. Anything to get my empire back.
I've brought this scoundrel claiming to be the old Emperor as per Emperor Werner's orders. I request an audience with him as soon as possible.
No, you brute. You wretch. You, uh...brute? I will have revenge yes I will ha ha ha.
I'd heard there was a suspicious person lurking about here. Excellent work. You may enter.
(The fool fell for our trap hook, line, and sinker! Everything's going so well!)
(Saboa and Magnus are the ones who have me right now, and they're going to encourage Werner to confirm if I'm really who I claim to be.)
(And once he leans in close, they'll both take him out from behind!)
(Oh, you traitorous slime! I'm going to... Wait, huh?)
N-no one's here! What's going on?
It can't be!
To think you'd throw your life away after your miraculous survival. You're more of a fool than I ever thought.
We're surrounded!
Did you really think the three of you could kill ME? Ha! ...And who's under that helmet there? Magnus, maybe? Take it off and show me who you are.
So you saw through our plan...
Why, I saw this coming from miles away! Did you never once consider how easy it was for this idiot to enter the castle?
But...my incredible stealth techniques!
You couldn't sneak through a snowstorm in a white suit! That said, I must admit to finding myself admiring such unparalleled faith in one's own pathetic skill.
Well, SOMEBODY has to say nice things about me once in a while!
Well, I wouldn't worry about that anymore; I'm taking your head here and now.
EEEK! SABOA! MAGNUS! SAVE MEEEE!
I'll create an opening for you, Majesty! Use it to escape!
It's no use, Magnus. Look at all of my soldiers. Even if you sacrifice yourself, he'll be surrounded again in no time.
Besides, what good will it do to protect a gutless coward like that? However...if you willingly renounce your allegiance to him, I will spare your lives.
(Crap, crap, crap! There's no way they won't sell me out after a line like that!)
Emperor Emile is not the coward here, Werner—YOU are.
What did you say to me?
It is not cowardice to rely on others. In fact, it is the mark of a wise ruler. We are simply demonstrating that we are worthy of such trust.
Magnus, I...
You only wormed your way into power through a yellow-bellied assassination attempt, so who's the real coward?
For your insolence, Magnus, you will be the first to die.
OVER HERE, YOU SPINELESS TWIT!
Oh, what is it now?
Oooo, look at me! I'm a big bad emperor who poisons people and fights them when I have them outnumbered! Ooo la la!
You know what I think? I think you're doing this because you're SCARED of me!
You test my patience, wretch.
Oh, don't like that? Then come face me like a man! I'll wipe the floor with you and your whole chump Dyrenell family!
If you insist upon single combat, then single combat you shall have.
You will serve as an example to all of what happens when I am defied.
Tomorrow, we will duel before the citizens of this country so the idiots you once ruled can see you slaughtered in the street!
Why did you provoke him like that, Your Majesty?!
Are you serious? If you weren't around, I'd have one less person to protect me— and that's a problem.
I marvel at your willingness to sacrifice yourself for our sakes, Majesty...
Er, but...do you think you can win?
O-of course! I'm the great and powerful Emperor Emile!
(...Well, this is a fine mess. I'm in way over my head here, but I was so carried away I just up and said it!)
(How in Ilia's name am I going to get myself out of this mess?!)
We will now commence the duel between Emperor Werner and the scoundrel who claims to be the former emperor!
I'm surprised you didn't turn tail and flee like the craven you are.
That's rich, coming from King Coward!
(Oh, trust me, I very much wanted to run— but SOMEBODY posted guards to make sure I couldn't!)
Let me give you an advantage, cur! You may have the first strike. Come at me however you will.
You think you're better than me?! You're nothing more than a damn MINISTER!
Whaaaat?! He sent my sword flying in a single hit!
You seem to have underestimated me. But now that we have a brief moment, do you know why I served you as an official rather than a soldier?
It was to hide my skill with a blade. Had you ever realized that, your guard would have been raised and I could not have caught you unawares as I did.
AAAAAUGH! Dammit, that hurt!
This match is already mine, but it would hardly strike obedience and fear in the hearts of the people were I to end it now.
Hrrrk! Nnnngh! D-damn you...
You're still trying to stand? Pathetic!
You never had what it takes to be an emperor! You're naught but useless trash!
Guy's pactbound dragon bailed on him, and then the brother he thought was a huge chump waxed the floor with him. Woof! Talk about your rough days.
How come we get saddled with a lousy commander like that? Hell, I'll take a traitor prince over a loser prince any day!
(A truth I see better than anyone. I KNOW I'm not fit to be emperor!)
Oh, yes. I thought you might be a king of literature, one able to change our militaristic nation.
Farewell to you, my son. I pray that you become a good and just ruler.
Father! It was you who said that to me!
Well, there's putting fear in hearts, and then there's just gilding the lily. Time for you to die now.
AAAAUUUUGH!
Hmph. Useless trash to the end.
Shut...your damn...mouth...
What?
How?! How are you standing again?! Just give up and die already!
Not a chance... I'm not even close to giving up now, you empty-headed dolt.
Oh, I know I'm useless when it comes to fighting or magic—and I'm painfully well aware that I don't actually have what it takes to be an emperor.
But I have someone in my life who believed I could be a good and just ruler despite all of that.
I have people who told me I had gifts possessed by no one else!
And I've found a way to get others to see my talent for what it is!
So I'm never giving up on this country! Not now, and not EVER!
Your...talent? Oh, this ought to be good. And what, pray tell, might this talent be?
THE FINE ARTS!
Aaaah ha ha ha! The arts? THE ARTS?! Do you really think you can rule a country with PAINTINGS?!
Cram it, four-eyes! I'm gonna change this country from the ground up!
I'll turn it into a peaceful nation where the arts can flourish! The Dyrenell Empire is mine to change, and I AM GOING TO DO IT!
Now get your ugly, warmongering mug out of my damn throne room!
What?! A dragon?!
(Uhhhhhh...did I just shapeshift?)
(Well, no point thinking about it now. Time to end this!)
ROOOOOAR!
But this worthless runt CAN'T shapeshift! How is this happening?!
AAAAAAAUUUUGH!
I...won?
A most splendid victory, Your Majesty!
But when did you manage to make another pact with a dragon?
I, uh...actually have no idea.
But maybe I just awakened some secret power I've always had deep down inside!
I'm afraid not.
The Waterwyrm? Good! I'm GLAD you're here, because now you can explain what in the name of caviar just happened!
You can thank Euden.
Oh no. Not him. Anyone but him.
Normally, the pact between a dragon and a possessor of dragonblood belongs only to the two of them.
But it would seem the Windwyrm has forged a pact stating that any whom Euden deems worthy may also receive a dragon's power.
Only through a bond of trust can one share their ability to shapeshift with another.
He has always accepted you as one of his older brothers, which is why you were able to shapeshift today.
Wait, but that's not... He would never... OH, YOU HAVE TO BE KIDDING ME!
He took everything from me, yet continues to show up and give me whatever I want!
He's a miserable little insect with a terrible attitude, and I hate that about him!
Your Majesty, I believe you should give your victory speech to the people?
Right... Yes, of course.
Might I ask a question, Waterwyrm?
Of course.
Why did the emperor shapeshift into you?
The seventh scion has made pacts with numerous dragons, so why is it that he transformed into you in particular?
The ability to shapeshift in and of itself is  due to Euden's pact.
However, we are able to choose who we wish to share our power with.
Regardless of his motivations, Emile has decided to create a nation of peace, and so I chose to share my power with him.
Whether I do so again depends on his actions from here on out. But I was witness to how hard he worked for this, so call it something of a...special favor.
I understand. Ah, look.
It seems the future has finally become clear for Emperor Emile, King Aurelius.
People of Dyrenell! I, your beloved Emperor Emile, have ousted the pretender!
From this day forth, our country is going to change! We will no longer be a nation of endless war, but one of endless peace!
The grand Emperor Emile has made his long-awaited return! Rejoice, my people!
Long live Emperor Emile! Long live Emperor Emile!
Some months after Emile's return to the throne
Emperor Emile has really taken a liking to those clothes, hasn't he? Er, but were they not originally a disguise?
It's quite impressive how the Waterwyrm was able to pinpoint what His Majesty would love in the short amount of time she was pactbound to him.
Magnus! Quit your idle chitchat and tell me how our legislation is progressing!
Of course, Majesty. Discussions between us and the people's representatives have been going smoothly, and we should have something to present very soon.
I must say, you've made quite the decision to allow the people to govern themselves.
Hmph. I'm just letting them clean up their own messes. It should be fine so long as I check from time to time and ensure all is running smoothly.
Besides, I was working too hard anyway. We at the top of the heap aren't supposed to do everything ourselves, you know!
Indeed, the Dyrenell empire has made a most spectacular comeback.
And your proactive call for artists and opera troupes has turned our capital into a place of beauty and grace.
The economy has seen a boost as a result, thus improving the people's quality of life. Additionally, we've seen an increase in applicants for the academy.
Of COURSE we have! I need these churls to be smart enough to understand my artistic finesse and greatness.
To say our neighbors are shocked would be an understatement; the last thing they ever thought the Dyrenell Empire would become is a haven for the arts.
Our country has finally become one that suits you, Majesty.
A country that...suits me?
But you could never become one of them, Your Majesty!
(Because I can't be anyone but myself.)
Er, I mean, naturally! I am a genius, after all, and I'm going to succeed in something my siblings could not even begin to conceive of!
Emperor Emile, we've received a message from Prince Leonidas!
Leonidas?!
Probably going to tell me to quit while I'm ahead, but let's see it...
＂We have sensed a looming disaster in the northern part of the continent, and it is likely the south will suffer as well.＂
＂I ask that you send reinforcements to help Euden and his people.＂
And why would I ever throw myself into the line of fire like that?!
Besides, Valkaheim is way closer to the north than we are, so maybe he should... Wait a minute.
Aaaah ha ha ha! I see how it is! Leonidas is providing opportunity for me to force Euden into my debt!
R-right...
I doubt that that is the case, but I suppose all that matters is that it gives him the motivation to act.
Listen up, all of you! We're forming an expeditionary force and heading for the north at once!
Soon, all will bow before the glory of the great and powerful Emperor Emile!
